page.title: 02RUCHAZIE COMMUNITY PROJECT
page.content: This three year{Urban Aid}funded project was set up in 1984. It is innovatory in Glasgow in that a Social Worker is based in a primary school to work in close co-operation with a teacher. Both form a link to facilitate interaction between two agencies,{Social Work}and{Education. This is for the benefit of the children attending Ruchazie Primary in particular and the community in general. The community teacher's role is primarily a supportive one, helping class teachers with pupils who have social problems by home visiting, team teaching etc. and from this setting up a programme of help. The Social Worker's normal role is aided by his presence in the school in that it becomes a supportive and confidence building device. Administrative backup is provided by the clerical assistant.
